required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Biomarker Study of Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumours
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Longitudinal Observation Trial of Clinical and Molecular Features of Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumours

brief_summary.textblock: The biology of pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors can change during the disease course. This evolution of disease can manifest through increases in tumor proliferation rate, resistance to medical therapy and/or a change in tumor hormone secretion. This study aims to characterize how the biology of pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors change over time, measured by; patient symptoms, biochemistry, contrast enhanced computed tomography, DOTATOC-PET, FDG-PET and core needle biopsy with histopathological analysis (Ki67 index and tumor cell differentiation). Uptake on 68Ga-DOTATOC and 18F-FDG-PET will be correlated directly to tumor cell proliferation rate. Fraction of patients with spatial heterogeneity in DOTATOC as well as FDG uptake as well as metachronous changes in all collected data will be documented. Biomaterial from whole blood and core needle biopsies will be characterized on the molecular level, and those findings will be integrated to the above specified clinical parameters.

primary_outcome.description: Defined as the proportion of patients where that following investigations are performed: Core needle biopsy, FDG-PET, DOTATOC-PET, research blood samples, pancreatic hormones and hormonal syndromes.

other_outcome.measure: Safety of core needle biopsy: NCI Common Terminology Criteria
other_outcome.time_frame: At study inclusion and within 48 hours of the procedure
other_outcome.description: Defined as a NCI Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events 4.03 grade 3-4 adverse event related to the procedure.

intervention.description: Computed tomography of thorax and abdomen with 3-phase contrast
Core needle biopsy of metastatic lesions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age â‰¥18 years
- Informed consent
- Pathology confirmed diagnosis of pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor WHO grade 1-3 or neuroendocrine carcinoma grade 3.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient does not consent
- Pregnancy or no contraceptive in fertile women.
